report_title: Construction Machinery Manufacturing in the US
executive_summary: Construction machinery manufacturers produce equipment for residential, nonresidential, highway and other infrastructure construction. Demand for construction machinery depends on the level of private construction spending and government funding for infrastructure projects. Manufacturers also rely on international markets and are susceptible to changes in global trade conditions, particularly tariffs, international conflicts and regulation changes. Volatile steel prices have also impacted construction machinery manufacturers, hindering profit through 2023.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Residential Market Booms Support Manufacturers at the Beginning of the Pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: During the initial stages of the pandemic, the federal government aimed to prevent an economic crisis by financially supporting US taxpayers. These stimulus checks boosted working families' disposable income, which, in some cases, enabled them to move homes. The Federal Reserve also reduced interest rates to prevent an economic crash. Historically, low interest rates make construction projects attractive, including the construction of new homes and home renovations.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Nonresidential Sector Struggles Amid Uncertain Economic Conditions
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The pandemic and growing work-from-home trends have hindered the nonresidential construction sector because of climbing office building vacancy rates and economic uncertainty. Higher interest rates also led to growing uncertainty within the financial markets. The larger interest rate hikes created panic among investors, discouraging new construction projects and harming construction machinery sales.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The US Dollar's Strength Hurts Export Markets
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Recent international conflicts have encouraged foreign investors to seek safety with the US dollar, causing it to appreciate. A strong dollar raises the price of domestic machinery overseas, harming exports. Similarly, an appreciating dollar reduces the price of imported machinery for domestic consumers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Commodity Price Volatility Poses a Threat to Manufacturers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Construction machinery manufacturers have endured significant price volatility through the current period. In particular, skyrocketing steel and oil prices have led to expanding purchase costs and profit contractions. Many larger manufacturers were able to pass cost increases onto buyers or secure long-term contracts to maintain steady profit. These companies have managed to expand profit. Smaller manufacturers have struggled with climbing input costs, leading to stagnating revenue.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Infrastructure plans rely on construction machinery
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Biden administration has already heavily invested in national infrastructure, creating a growing need for construction machinery. In particular, the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (IIJA) includes constructing and maintaining roads, bridges and rails, expanding access to clean energy and replacing water infrastructure.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Nonresidential construction rebounds amid growing confidence
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Falling building vacancy rates will boost optimism among investors, encouraging new commercial construction. Even so, investors will remain wary of the economic outlook, causing a languid recovery within the nonresidential construction sector.

The world's recovery from the pandemic and strengthening supply chains will lead to the dollar's depreciation to historical norms through the outlook period. This trend will cause US construction machinery to become comparatively more affordable, boosting export activity.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Companies benefit from interest rate normalization
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Through the latter half of the outlook period, interest rates will normalize as the Federal Reserve reverses rate trends. This trend will lead to more robust growth in the construction sector, encouraging buyers to take on larger investments.

industry_definition: Industry operators manufacture construction machinery and equipment for use in residential, nonresidential, highway, street and other infrastructure construction.
key_trends: Slowed construction activity limits demand for machinery.
Increasing economic uncertainty and elevated interest rates have hindered demand for new construction projects
Volatile input prices raise costs for manufacturers
Infrastructure spending has helped to mitigate falling construction activity as interest rates rise.
Domestic producers have a positive reputation overseas
Construction companies try to fix machines before purchasing new ones
Residential construction boomed during the pandemic
Easy access to raw materials lowers costs
Highly populated areas engage in more construction projects
Environmentally friendly machinery lowers operating costs for construction companies

market_segmentation.segment_description: The pandemic led to higher levels of residential construction, as many workers found themselves with higher levels of disposable income and the ability to relocate to other geographies. The residential market has completely reversed, primarily due to increasing interest rates creating higher mortgage rates. Continued rate increases have posed a major threat to this market.

Large-scale construction, namely infrastructure projects, office blocks and commercial centers, rely on construction machinery. Many investors paused construction projects during the pandemic; demand for new office buildings fell following work-from-home preferences, empty office spaces and business closures. Federal spending and programs have supported this market.

Public projects make up a notable portion of demand for construction machinery manufacturers. The country's aging bridges and roadways has encouraged federal and local governments to invest in road repairs.

Paper usage has steadily declined as more companies digitalize everyday processes. This trend reduces demand from paper companies that need pulp and paper supplies, which need construction machinery to be extracted.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Tractor Shovels, Loaders, Dozers and Other Tractors

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Increased spending on constructing offices and commercial buildings, schools, hospitals, factories, power plants, mining shafts, communication lines and railroads directly benefits manufacturers.

The value of residential construction measures private spending on single and multifamily structures, manufactured homes, dormitories, improvements on existing locations, brokers' commissions and net purchases of used structures.
Annual public and private expenditure on constructing power, sewage or water supply infrastructure drives demand for heavy construction machinery.
Interest rates impact borrowing costs for investors, businesses and individuals. When interest rates are high, borrowers face higher rates, discouraging them from engaging in construction.
High spending levels on highways and streets stimulate demand for the road-building equipment that the industry manufactures.

international_trade_points.trade_title: An appreciating dollar hurts domestic producers
international_trade_points.trade_description: Since the pandemic, the US dollar significantly appreciated. This trend has caused the price of foreign-produced machinery to weaken, making imports more attractive for construction companies.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Recovery in the construction sector grows demand for imports
international_trade_points.trade_description: Demand for domestic machinery abroad will grow in 2023, alongside demand for nonresidential construction. As construction activity in the United States recovers, demand for affordable inputs will expand, boosting imports and weakening domestic consumption.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Manufacturers will benefit from the US dollar's depreciation
international_trade_points.trade_description: Foreign currencies will stabilize as the global economy continues to recover from the impact of the pandemic, global tensions and major supply chain disruptions through the outlook period. A weakening dollar will cause domestic machinery to grow in popularity as it becomes more affordable when compared with foreign products.
Trade agreements with Colombia, Panama, Canada and South Korea will raise demand for domestic construction machinery. The USMCA will also continue to provide steady demand from Canada and Mexico.

business_locations.location_description: Many manufacturers, including Caterpillar and Deere & Company, have based operations in the Great Lakes region. This region has a prolific manufacturing infrastructure, leading to easier access to key suppliers. Manufacturers located in the Great Lakes region benefit from steel imported from Canada to produce machinery. Many companies also leverage trade with Canada through the Detroit-Windsor Tunnel.

The plains make up a lower percentage of the population but remains a manufacturer-dense area given close proximity to key steel and iron producers in the Great Lakes. Easy access to raw materials benefits manufacturers from the region. Companies can also leverage proximity to Canada to engage in trade.

The Southeast's high population has led to elevated demand for construction projects. Many companies have relocated in the Southeast to take advantage of lower taxes, resulting in elevated nonresidential construction. Many manufacturers have moved to the region to take advantage of higher construction levels. The Southeast's High Population Gives Manufacturers Access to a Larger Available Labor Pool. Manufacturers in this region often prioritize trade with Mexico, too.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Manufacturers must comply with regulations to limit air pollution. Moreover, manufacturers are required to consider air pollution regulations during the design process, as new machinery needs to meet air emission regulations as well.

Multiple governmental agencies are involved in issuing regulations regarding international trade of construction machinery manufacturers and business. Manufacturers are expected to comply with domestic regulations and foreign ones, mainly due to the industry's highly globalized and trade-heavy nature.

Alongside air emissions standards, manufacturers must adhere to water and noise regulations set by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and state and local governments. Many types of power equipment must also meet standard fuel efficiency requirements.

Construction machinery manufacturers must adhere to standard workplace regulations from the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) alongside state and local labor laws regarding safety and wage.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Industry assistance is low and steady.

factors_decreased_barrier: Manufacturers have increasingly invested in automation and artificial technology to streamline design and production.
Manufacturers rely on skilled labor to operate machinery, design products and complete other service and quality-related tasks.

basis_points.basis_description: Low-cost, high-performing machinery enables construction companies to reduce costs, leading to more repeat sales.

Environmentally friendly machinery lowers operating costs for construction companies. Construction companies prefer green technology since it enables them to comply with environmental regulations and create sustainable supply chains.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Large Manufacturers Benefit From Economies of Scale
concentration_points.concentration_description: Economies of scale enable large manufacturers to reduce costs, producing more machinery at lower per-unit costs.
Brand recognition benefits major manufacturers locally and internationally, driving purchases.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Manufacturers need steel, iron, engines, castings, drive trains, hydraulics, motors, electronics and other machinery components for production. Commodity prices, particularly steel costs, have grown highly volatile due to supply chain issues, international trade conditions, trade agreements and tariffs.
Revenue growth has outpaced wages through the current period as companies turn to automation and AI to streamline production and design tasks.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Manufacturers have increasingly invested in automation
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Manufacturers have increasingly invested in automation and artificial technology to streamline design and production.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Low rate of new patents and concentration of patents
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry is experiencing a low level of both the rate of new patents and the concentration of patents in the industry.
The major markets for this industry are highly concentrated, which implies that the market has a focus on key customer segments.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Commodity Price Volatility Leads to Uncertainty
volatility_points.volatility_description: Steel is a key input for construction machinery manufacturers; trade wars and supply chain contractions have caused steel prices to skyrocket through the current period.
Major construction projects increase demand for construction machinery. Elevated interest rates have slashed construction activity, leading to higher borrowing costs.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: THE NEED FOR EXCAVATION AND MINING MACHINERY HAS WEAKENED
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Contractors use power cranes, draglines and shovels for major construction projects requiring precision in large areas.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: DEMAND FOR OTHER TOOLS DEPENDS ON GEOGRAPHIC NEEDS
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Manufacturers offer a diversity of tools for specific needs, including crushing plants, screening plants, washing plants, snow clearing attachments, horizontal earth boring machinery.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Transportation and Cleanup Equipment Generates Stable Demand
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Buyers commonly use tractor shovel loaders, dozers and other tractors in most construction projects to transport commodities.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Most Buyers Will Prefer Parts for Repairs
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Construction machinery is a costly investment. Buyers often prefer to replace broken parts rather than replace entire apparatus.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Graders, Maintainers and Mixers Make Up the Remainder of Revenue
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Buyers use graders, maintainers, and mixers to finish and prepare surfaces.

FAQs.question: Do your sales depend on the overall health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Demand for construction machinery will depend on the level of construction activity, and is therefore procyclical.

FAQs.question: Does your company operate in one vertical or participate in a number of verticals?
FAQs.answer: Diversified manufacturers will exhibit lower revenue volatility and increased profitability.

FAQs.question: Is your company located in proximity to key buying and selling markets?
FAQs.answer: Manufacturers located in proximity to downstream industries will experience lower transportation costs.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to increased import competition?
FAQs.answer: Demand for industry imports is usually price dependent.

FAQs.question: How has your company been leveraging the latest technologies?
FAQs.answer: Operators leveraging the latest technologies will exhibit higher operating efficiencies and demand.

FAQs.question: Has your company been able to reduce wage costs through automation?
FAQs.answer: Manufacturers that automate production will lower variable costs.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all occupational health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Compliant operators will exhibit lower insurance premiums.

FAQs.question: Is your company prepared to adapt to shifting environmental standards?
FAQs.answer: Manufacturers of construction machinery with a penchant for sustainability may be favored by the market.

FAQs.question: How does your profitability compare to that of your competitors?
FAQs.answer: Those who engage in long-term supply contracts will exhibit more stable revenue.

FAQs.question: Does your company face any difficulty financing ongoing operations?
FAQs.answer: High interest rates and low access to credit will hinder the ability of industry operators.

FAQs.question: Do you have access to the latest available and most efficient technology and techniques?
FAQs.answer: Access to technology is crucial for success.

FAQs.question: How do you adapt to changes due to new environmental regulations?
FAQs.answer: Compliance with US legislation and standards will help operators avoid fines.

FAQs.question: How do you attract and retain skilled employees?
FAQs.answer: Building and retaining a multiskilled and flexible workforce can include negotiating agreements.

FAQs.question: Do you closely monitor interest rates?
FAQs.answer: High interest rates hurt demand for residential and nonresidential structures.

FAQs.question: How much of your business comes from residential construction companies?
FAQs.answer: Higher residential construction generally boosts demand for related machinery.

FAQs.question: How much have you relied on exports in recent years?
FAQs.answer: The industry is a major exporter of construction equipment.
